episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and historical topics, including theories about the origin of life, the history of postcards, the fashionability of a French executioner, and the high value and security of Sicilian pistachios.

facts.fact: Theories for the origin of life on earth include primordial soup, primordial sandwich, primordial soup and sandwich, primordial pizza, and primordial mayonnaise.
The world's oldest postcard was sent by a writer called Theodore Hook. He sent it to himself.
The first man to kill people by guillotine was briefly so fashionable that French people would dress up as him.
In Sicily, the pistachios are guarded by the military police.
